availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
25
The Governor transmitted to the General Assembly through the hands of the Assistant Secretary the Virginia Resolutions asking a conference of the States at Washington on the 4th day of February next
He appointed the followoing Notaries Public Wm W. Howard for Nicholas county and Jno. R. Robinson for Taylor County
He Caused to be filed the oath of R. Brenan Comr of Deeds for Louisiana
He respited for twelve months the following Judgments.

row.cell: Webster Co J. P. ct. vs. H. L Bell

body.p:
Jany 25
The Governor remitted to M. Coyle a Judgment of the Jefferson Circuit Court of $1000. upon a forfeited -- recognizance
He commissioned Chas R. Samuel 3d Lieutenant.
Also the following persons in the State Guard for the County of Ballard Jos W Logan Adjutant. Jos D White Quarter Master Geo. W Utterback Paymaster and George Stoveall Surgeon
He commissioned Theod H Lowe 2d Lieut in the Corps of Engineers, with the Rank of 2d Lieut: & Chas A Fisher Asst: Surgeon with the Rank of 1st Lieut.
He commissioned R. Cobb Colonel of the Enrolled Militia for Lyon county.
He commissioned Thos Webb Asst. Surgeon with the Rank of 1st Lieut. Also
He approved and signed enrolled Bills Chapters 4 & 5 and Resolution No 1.
